query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Ora cen porta l’un de’ duri margini; 2 e ’l fummo del ruscel di sopra aduggia, 3 sì che dal foco salva l’acqua e li argini.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Now one of the hard banks bears us up; 2 and the smoke from the brook below darkens the air, 3 so that it saves the water and the banks from the fire.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Adyaiva naḥ kaścid dṛḍhaḥ parśvaḥ bibharti; 2 adhaśca nadyaḥ dhūmaḥ āvarayati nabhaḥ, 3 yathā agneḥ udakāni tat-tīrāṇi ca rakṣati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Quali Fiamminghi tra Guizzante e Bruggia, 5 temendo ’l fiotto che ’nver’ lor s’avventa, 6 fanno lo schermo perché ’l mar si fuggia;
7 e quali Padoan lungo la Brenta, 8 per difender lor ville e lor castelli, 9 anzi che Carentana il caldo senta:
10 a tale imagine eran fatti quelli, 11 tutto che né sì alti né sì grossi, 12 qual che si fosse, lo maestro félli.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Like the Flemings between Wissant and Bruges, 5 fearing the flood that rushes toward them, 6 build a dike so that the sea may flee;
7 and like the Paduans along the Brenta, 8 to defend their towns and castles, 9 before the heat makes the Brenta boil:
10 in such a manner were those [demons] made, 11 although neither so tall nor so large, 12 whoever he was, the master who made them.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Yathā Flāmingāḥ Guizzante ca Bruggiyā ca madhye, 5 bhayamānāḥ pravāhāt yaḥ teṣāṃ prati āgacchati, 6 prākāraṃ kurvanti yena samudraḥ palāyate;
7 tathā ca Pādovanāḥ Brentāyāḥ tīre, 8 sva-nagara-durga-rakṣaṇāya, 9 pūrvam eva yāvat Carentanā uṣṇatām na pratipadyate:
10 tādṛśīṃ mūrtim āpannaḥ āsan te, 11 yadyapi na tathā ūrdhvaḥ na ca tathā sthūlaḥ, 12 yaḥ kaścit abhūt, kartā yaḥ cakāra tān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Già eravam da la selva rimossi 14 tanto, ch’i’ non avrei visto dov’ era, 15 perch’ io in dietro rivolto mi fossi,
16 quando incontrammo d’anime una schiera 17 che venian lungo l’argine, e ciascuna 18 ci riguardava come suol da sera
19 guardare uno altro sotto nuova luna; 20 e sì ver’ noi aguzzavan le ciglia 21 come ’l vecchio sartor fa ne la cruna.
query.result:
**English:**
13 We had already departed so far from the forest 14 that I would not have seen where it was, 15 even if I had turned back to look,
16 when we encountered a troop of spirits 17 who were coming along the bank, and each one 18 was looking at us as people are wont to do
19 when they look at each other under a new moon; 20 and they were squinting their eyes at us 21 like an old tailor does at the eye of a needle.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Giyāvamaḥ asmāt vanaḥ asmāt tataḥ 14 Tāvān ayam aham na paśyāmi kutra ayam āsīt, 15 Yataḥ aham pṛṣṭhatasya abhimukhaḥ abhūvam,
16 Yatra ātmānaḥ ekaḥ samūhaḥ ājagāma 17 Ye āgacchanti sma tīreṇa, ekaikaśca 18 Asmān abhīkṣate sma yathā ādarāt sāyamkāle
19 Paśyati ekaḥ anyam nava candraḥ adhastāt; 20 Evaṃ asmābhiḥ saha teṣām netrāṇi tikṣṇāni āsan 21 Yathā vṛddhaḥ śaśtrakāraḥ sūcyāḥ netraṃ karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Così adocchiato da cotal famiglia, 23 fui conosciuto da un, che mi prese 24 per lo lembo e gridò: «Qual maraviglia!».
query.result:
**English:**
22 Thus observed by such a family, 23 I was recognized by one, who seized me 24 by the hem and cried out: "What a marvel!"
**Sanskrit:**
22 Evam adṛṣṭaḥ tādṛśena kulakena, 23 Ajñātaḥ aham abhūvam ekena, yaḥ gṛhītavān 24 Mama vastrasya antaṃ ca uktavān: "Kim idam adbhutam!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 E io, quando ’l suo braccio a me distese, 26 ficcaï li occhi per lo cotto aspetto, 27 sì che ’l viso abbrusciato non difese
28 la conoscenza süa al mio ’ntelletto; 29 e chinando la mano a la sua faccia, 30 rispuosi: «Siete voi qui, ser Brunetto?».
query.result:
**English:**
25 And I, when he stretched out his arm to me, 26 fixed my eyes on his baked appearance, 27 so that his scorched face did not prevent
28 my intellect from recognizing him; 29 and, reaching out my hand to his face, 30 I replied: "Are you here, Ser Brunetto?"
**Sanskrit:**
25 Ahaṃ ca, yadā sa bāhuṃ mama prati adadāt, 26 nirikṣito 'smi tasya dagdhasvarūpasya, 27 yathā dagdhamukhena na pratihataṃ
28 mama buddhyā tasya jñānam; 29 hastena ca tasya mukham ākramya, 30 pratyavādam: "Kim bhavān atra, śrīman Brunetto?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 E quelli: «O figliuol mio, non ti dispiaccia 32 se Brunetto Latino un poco teco 33 ritorna ’n dietro e lascia andar la traccia».
query.result:
**English:**
31 And they: "O my son, do not be displeased 32 if Brunetto Latino turns back a little with you 33 and lets the path go on."
**Sanskrit:**
31 Te caite: "He putrā mama, mā tvāṃ viṣādaḥ kurvīta 32 yadi Brunetto Latino alpam tvayā saha 33 pratipadyate pṛṣṭhato mārgaṃ ca muñcati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 I’ dissi lui: «Quanto posso, ven preco; 35 e se volete che con voi m’asseggia, 36 faròl, se piace a costui che vo seco».
query.result:
**English:**
34 I said to him: "As much as I can, come I pray you; 35 and if you wish that I should sit with you, 36 I will do so, if it pleases him with whom I go."
**Sanskrit:**
34 Aham uvāca tam: "Yāvad aham śaknomi, āgaccha prārthayāmi; 35 ca yadi icchasi yathā saha tvayā upaviśe, 36 karomi tat, yadi rocate asmāi saha yena gacchāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 «O figliuol», disse, «qual di questa greggia 38 s’arresta punto, giace poi cent’ anni 39 sanz’ arrostarsi quando ’l foco il feggia.
query.result:
**English:**
37 "O son," he said, "whoever of this flock 38 stops for a moment, lies there for a hundred years 39 without turning over when the fire strikes him.
**Sanskrit:**
37 "He bālaka," iti, "yaḥ asya paśugoṣṭhasya 38 kṣaṇam api tiṣṭhati, śete tataḥ śatam varṣāṇi 39 anāvartya ātmānam yadā agniḥ tam dahati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Però va oltre: i’ ti verrò a’ panni; 41 e poi rigiugnerò la mia masnada, 42 che va piangendo i suoi etterni danni».
query.result:
**English:**
40 But go on, I will come to you at the ford; 41 and then I will rejoin my company, 42 who go weeping for their eternal losses.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Tathāpi gaccha agre: aham tvām nadīm prati āgacchāmi; 41 Tataś ca punar āgacchāmi mama gaṇam prati, 42 Yaḥ śocati sva-nitya-kṣayān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Io non osava scender de la strada 44 per andar par di lui; ma ’l capo chino 45 tenea com’ uom che reverente vada.
query.result:
**English:**
43 I did not dare to descend from the road 44 to go past him; but I kept my head bowed 45 like a man who walks respectfully.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Na aham adhaḥpatane śaktaḥ āsām 44 Mārgasya parataḥ gantum; kim tu śiraḥ nīcam 45 Adhārṣam yathā bhaktaḥ puruṣaḥ gacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 El cominciò: «Qual fortuna o destino 47 anzi l’ultimo dì qua giù ti mena? 48 e chi è questi che mostra ’l cammino?».
query.result:
**English:**
46 He began: "What fortune or destiny 47 or the last day brings you down here? 48 And who is this who shows you the way?"
**Sanskrit:**
46 Saḥ ārabhata: "Kā devatā vā daivaṃ vā 47 atha vā mṛtyur atra tvām ānayati? 48 Kaś ca ayam yaḥ pathikam darśayati?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 «Là sù di sopra, in la vita serena», 50 rispuos’ io lui, «mi smarri’ in una valle, 51 avanti che l’età mia fosse piena.
query.result:
**English:**
49 "Up there, in the serene life," 50 I answered him, "I lost my way in a valley, 51 before my age was full.
**Sanskrit:**
49 "Upari tatra, jīvanasya praśāntasya," 50 pratyuttaram adadam asmai, "aham amārgam prapto 'bhuvam ekasmim, 51 pūrṇā me yāvat na babhūva vayas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Pur ier mattina le volsi le spalle: 53 questi m’apparve, tornand’ ïo in quella, 54 e reducemi a ca per questo calle».
query.result:
**English:**
52 Yet this morning I turned my back on them: 53 he appeared to me, as I was returning to that place, 54 and brought me back here by this road.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Tathāpi prātaḥkāle aham tasya pṛṣṭham adhāvam: 53 ayam mama pratipakṣe adarśata, mayā tatra pratyāgacchati, 54 mama ca imam mārgaṃ prati nayane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Ma quello ingrato popolo maligno 62 che discese di Fiesole ab antico, 63 e tiene ancor del monte e del macigno,
64 ti si farà, per tuo ben far, nimico; 65 ed è ragion, ché tra li lazzi sorbi 66 si disconvien fruttare al dolce fico.
query.result:
**English:**
61 But that ungrateful and wicked people 62 who came down from Fiesole long ago, 63 and still retains something of the mountain and the flint,
64 will make themselves your enemy because of your good deeds; 65 and it is right, because among the bitter sorbs 66 it is unfitting for the sweet fig to bear fruit.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Api tu ayam akṛtajñaḥ pāpaḥ prajāḥ 62 yaḥ Fiesoleḥ pūrvaṃ samavartayat, 63 yaśca adhunā api parvata-śilā-svabhāvaḥ asti,
64 tava śubha-karmaṇā tava śatrur bhaviṣyati; 65 yuktam eva, yataḥ kaṭuka-phalānāṃ madhye 66 madhura-phalasya jāyante na yuktāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Vecchia fama nel mondo li chiama orbi; 68 gent’ è avara, invidiosa e superba: 69 dai lor costumi fa che tu ti forbi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Ancient fame calls them blind in the world; 68 they are a miserly, envious, and proud people: 69 from their customs, see that you keep yourself.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Pūrvajāḥ kīrtayaḥ loke tānadhān cakṣuṣā virahitān ācakṣate; 68 janāḥ kṛpaṇāḥ, īrṣyāluḥ, madaḥ-anvitāḥ ca santi: 69 teṣāṃ ācārair viviktaḥ bhavatu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 La tua fortuna tanto onor ti serba, 71 che l’una parte e l’altra avranno fame 72 di te; ma lungi fia dal becco l’erba.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Your fortune reserves so much honor for you, 71 that both sides will be hungry 72 for you; but the grass will be far from the beak.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Tava daivaṃ tavat tejaḥ dhārayiṣyati, 71 yataḥ ubhe api pakṣau kṣudhāṃ prāpsyataḥ 72 tava; tathāpi durlabhā bhavitā tvam tebhyaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Faccian le bestie fiesolane strame 74 di lor medesme, e non tocchin la pianta, 75 s’alcuna surge ancora in lor letame,
76 in cui riviva la sementa santa 77 di que’ Roman che vi rimaser quando 78 fu fatto il nido di malizia tanta».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Let the beasts of Fiesole make dung 74 of themselves, and not touch the plant, 75 if any still springs up in their manure,
76 in which revives the holy seed 77 of those Romans who remained there when 78 the nest of so much malice was made.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Fiesole-nivāsinah paśavaḥ svayam eva viṣṭhāṃ kuryuḥ, 74 na ca vṛkṣaṃ spṛśeyuḥ, 75 yadi ko’pi vṛkṣaḥ adhuna api teṣāṃ viṣṭhāyāṃ jāyate,
76 yasmin punarujjīvati tat puṇyam bījam 77 teṣāṃ Rāmaṇānāṃ ye tatra sthitāḥ āsīt yadā 78 ati-durācāra-nīḍaṃ nirmitam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 «Se fosse tutto pieno il mio dimando», 80 rispuos’ io lui, «voi non sareste ancora 81 de l’umana natura posto in bando;
82 ché ’n la mente m’è fitta, e or m’accora, 83 la cara e buona imagine paterna 84 di voi quando nel mondo ad ora ad ora
85 m’insegnavate come l’uom s’etterna: 86 e quant’ io l’abbia in grado, mentr’ io vivo 87 convien che ne la mia lingua si scerna.
query.result:
**English:**
79 "If my request were fully granted," 80 I replied to him, "you would not yet be 81 banished from human nature;
82 for in my mind is fixed, and now pains me, 83 the dear and good paternal image 84 of you when in the world from time to time
85 you taught me how man makes himself eternal: 86 and how much I cherish it, while I live 87 it is fitting that my tongue should make known.
**Sanskrit:**
79 "Yadi mama sarvā icchā pūrṇā syāt," 80 aham tam prati avocat, "tadāpi tvam 81 mānuṣīyāḥ prakṛteḥ parityaktaḥ na bhaveyaḥ;
82 yataḥ mama manasi sthitā, adhunā ca mama duḥkham janayati, 83 tava priyā ca śubhā ca pitṛvatī mūrtiḥ 84 yadā tvam loke samaye samaye
85 mama upadesam adadāḥ katham naraḥ śāśvataḥ bhavati iti: 86 mama jīvanakāle mama ayam tava upadesaḥ katham priyaḥ asti, 87 mama jihvāyāṃ tad eva prakāśam bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Ciò che narrate di mio corso scrivo, 89 e serbolo a chiosar con altro testo 90 a donna che saprà, s’a lei arrivo.
query.result:
**English:**
88 What you narrate of my course I write, 89 and I reserve it to be sealed with another text 90 for a lady who will know, if I reach her.
**Sanskrit:**
88 Yattvam mama gatau varṇayasi tat likhāmi, 89 anyena granthena sahitam api raksāmi, 90 tasyāḥ strīyāḥ yadi tatra gacchāmi yā jānāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Tanto vogl’ io che vi sia manifesto, 92 pur che mia coscïenza non mi garra, 93 ch’a la Fortuna, come vuol, son presto.
query.result:
**English:**
91 So much do I want you to know this, 92 as long as my conscience does not deceive me, 93 that I am ready for Fortune, as she wishes.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Tāvān ahaṃ icchāmi yathā bhavatībhiḥ jñātam astu, 92 yāvad mama vijñānam māṃ na mohayati, 93 yathā daivam icchati tathā aham udyataḥ asmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Non è nuova a li orecchi miei tal arra: 95 però giri Fortuna la sua rota 96 come le piace, e ’l villan la sua marra».
query.result:
**English:**
94 Such a speech is not new to my ears: 95 but Fortune turns her wheel as she pleases, 96 and the peasant his mattock.
**Sanskrit:**
94 Naivāyam śravaṇe me navaḥ śabdaḥ: 95 Tathāpi bhramayati bhagavatī lakṣmī cakraṃ yathā svayaṃ priyate, 96 Kṛṣakaśca svakīyaṃ kuṭhāriṃ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Lo mio maestro allora in su la gota 98 destra si volse in dietro e riguardommi; 99 poi disse: «Bene ascolta chi la nota».
query.result:
**English:**
97 My master then turned to his right cheek, 98 looked back at me, 99 and said, "Listen well to what she says."
**Sanskrit:**
97 Mama ācāryaḥ atha upari dakṣiṇasya gandasya 98 Pratyavartata pṛṣṭhato mām ca apaśyat; 99 Tataḥ uvāca, "Śrṇu suśruṣayā yad eṣā vadati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Né per tanto di men parlando vommi 101 con ser Brunetto, e dimando chi sono 102 li suoi compagni più noti e più sommi.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Nevertheless, I will speak of them, 101 with Ser Brunetto, and ask who are 102 his most famous and greatest companions.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Na ca tathāpi tadvarṇanam tyajāmi, 101 Śrīmad-Brunettena saha, पृच्छāmi ca, ke 102 Asya sahāyāḥ sarveṣāṃ viśiṣṭāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Ed elli a me: «Saper d’alcuno è buono; 104 de li altri fia laudabile tacerci, 105 ché ’l tempo saria corto a tanto suono.
query.result:
**English:**
103 And he to me: "To know of some is good; 104 of the others it will be praiseworthy to be silent, 105 for time would be short for so much sound.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Sa ca mama: "Ekeṣāṃ jñānam śubham; 104 anyeṣāṃ tu maunaṃ prasaṃsyam, 105 yataḥ kālaḥ syāt alpaḥ tādṛśasya śabdasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 In somma sappi che tutti fur cherci 107 e litterati grandi e di gran fama, 108 d’un peccato medesmo al mondo lerci.
query.result:
**English:**
106 In short, know that all of them were sought out, 107 and great scholars and men of great fame, 108 were sullied in the world by the same sin.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Saṃkṣepeṇa jānīhi yathā sarve api te anveṣitāḥ, 107 ca viśiṣṭāḥ paṇḍitāḥ ca mahāyasasaḥ, 108 ekasya eva pāpasya jagati malair āliptāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Priscian sen va con quella turba grama, 110 e Francesco d’Accorso anche; e vedervi, 111 s’avessi avuto di tal tigna brama,
112 colui potei che dal servo de’ servi 113 fu trasmutato d’Arno in Bacchiglione, 114 dove lasciò li mal protesi nervi.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Priscian goes with that wretched throng, 110 and Francesco d’Accorso also; and you would have seen them, 111 if you had had such a craving for that plank,
112 he who by the servant of servants 113 was transferred from the Arno to the Bacchiglione, 114 where he left his sinews ill stretched.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Priscianus gacchati tena janena durācāra, 110 ca Franciscus de Accorso api; ca draṣṭum eos, 111 yadi te abhilāṣaḥ āsīt tādṛśasya daṇḍasya,
112 saḥ śaknuvan aham, yaḥ sevaka-sevakatvena 113 Arno-nadīyāḥ Bacchiglione-nadīm anu parivartitaḥ āsīt, 114 yatra saḥ jaghāna duritaprasāritāni snāyu-bandhāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Di più direi; ma ’l venire e ’l sermone 116 più lungo esser non può, però ch’i’ veggio 117 là surger nuovo fummo del sabbione.
query.result:
**English:**
115 I would say more, but coming and speaking 116 can be no longer, because I see 117 new smoke rising from the sandy plain.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Adhikaṃ vakṣyāmi; api tu āgamanaṃ ca kathanaṃ ca 116 Dīrghataraṃ bhavitum na śaknoti, yataḥ aham paśyāmi 117 Tatrābhūtanavaṃ dhūmaṃ vālukāmayaṃ utthitam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Gente vien con la quale esser non deggio. 119 Sieti raccomandato il mio Tesoro, 120 nel qual io vivo ancora, e più non cheggio».
query.result:
**English:**
118 People are coming with whom I should not be. 119 May my Treasure be commended to you, 120 in which I still live, and I ask no more.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Janā āgacchanti yaiḥ saha na me bhavitavyam. 119 Samanujñātaḥ astu mama Kośaḥ, 120 Yasmin aham adyāpi jīvāmi, na ca param icchāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Poi si rivolse, e parve di coloro 122 che corrono a Verona il drappo verde 123 per la campagna; e parve di costoro
124 quelli che vince, non colui che perde.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then he turned around, and seemed like those 122 who run in Verona for the green cloth 123 through the countryside; and he seemed like one of those
124 who wins, not the one who loses.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Tataḥ sa pravavrte, ca adṛśyata iva teṣām 122 ye Veronae currunt pro viridi panno 123 per rura; ca adṛśyata iva illorum
124 is victor, non is victus.
